intro: Calotis hispidula var. sessiliceps, commonly known as the woolly calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
